description: False Indigo is a beautiful ornamental plant species. With its delicate gray-green foliage and vibrant white blooms, it is sure to make an impact in any garden landscape. Though it typically grows tall and spreads relatively wide, the Pendula Group of this particular species can be enjoyed in a container garden setting as well, in sizes up to five feet. False Indigos are considered low maintenance plants, requiring minimal pruning and watering throughout the season. Plus, they are native to North America and are hardy in a variety of soil and climate conditions. With the majestic beauty they generate when in full bloom and their versatile nature, false indigo is an amazing addition to any garden.
